oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Centennial celebrations; Exhibitions; Exhibition buildings; Midways; Mirrors; Entertainment; Optical illusions; Celebrations; Anniversaries; Commemorations; Events; Festivals; Fairs; Forensic photographs
Tennessee Centennial and International Exposition (1897 : Nashville, Tenn.)
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Front view of the castle-like structure of W. Spain's Palace of Illusions and Mirror Maze, featured in the Vanity Fair area of the Tennessee Centennial Exposition, 1897. A number of men and women are standing at the entrance area, surrounded by signs promoting the attractions.

This building was located within Vanity Fair, the amusement section of the Tennessee Centennial Exposition, at the western corner of the park. The structure housed two distinct exhibitions which could both be viewed for the admission price of 25 cents. The image was found in Tennessee Supreme Court case J.B. Ellison vs. W.P. Spain as Exhibit No. 1 to the deposition of C.G. Walden.
